overview:
Commuter Advertising is the world’s first provider of audio advertising onboard public transit vehicles.

The company partners with transit authorities and sells advertising space and time onboard the city’s transit vehicles to increase revenue for public transportation systems, allowing for stable rider fares and larger transit authority budgets.

The audio advertisements are played at a reasonable frequency, never exceeding 15 seconds. Additionally, Commuter Advertising encourages its advertisers to offer commuters an incentive, such as a discount or other offer with purchase. This mutually-beneficial relationship enables the continued success of all parties involved: commuters, public transit authorities, and advertisers alike.

Commuter Advertising is headquartered in Dayton, Ohio, and operates in cities around the United States, including: Chicago and Champaign, IL; Toledo and Dayton, OH; Kansas City, Missouri; Jacksonville, FL; and Rockland County, NY.
